text: Aimé-Romarin Billong (born June 11, 1970) is a Cameroonian former professional footballer who played as a defender. Born in Moundou, Chad, Billong played for the Cameroon national football team and a few clubs in France. In October 1999 he signed for Premier League side West Ham United to play under Harry Redknapp. However, he never made a first team appearance for the club. He was a participant at the 1998 African Cup of Nations, playing in the group match against Burkina Faso and the quarterfinal against Congo DR.Courtney, Barrie. "African Nations Cup 1998 - Final Tournament Details" . RSSSF, June 5, 2005. Retrieved on May 3, 2013. Billong also represented Cameroon during 1998 World Cup qualifiers, but he was not included in the 22-man squad for the final tournament in France. ==References== ==External links== * * * Biography Category:Living people Category:1970 births Category:Association football defenders Category:Cameroonian footballers Category:Cameroon international footballers Category:1998 African Cup of Nations players Category:Ligue 1 players Category:Olympique Lyonnais players Category:AS Saint-Étienne players Category:West Ham United F.C. players Category:AS Nancy players Category:Cameroonian expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in France Category:Expatriate footballers in England Category:ESCP Europe alumni
title: Romarin Billong
